news_header: Israel has killed the commander of Hamas in southern Lebanon, who was reportedly planning attacks on Israel with Iranian support. Lebanese security has not confirmed the victim's identity, but sources indicate he was affiliated with the Palestinian militant group.
news_original_title: Israel sanoo tappaneensa Hamasin johtajan Libanonissa
news_text: Lebanese President Joseph Aoun expressed concerns about Israel's full withdrawal from Lebanon by the cease-fire deadline of February 18, despite Israel's proposal to maintain troops at five bases in the region.
